sentences.sContent: An ominous air emits from the chalice, gripping the hearts of those who peer at it as if determined to drag them to the world of the dead.
sentences.sContent_eng: An ominous air emits from the chalice, gripping the hearts of those who peer at it as if determined to drag them to the world of the dead.
sentences.sCn: 一股不祥的气息从这个圣杯中散发出来，抓住那些窥视它的人们的心，仿佛下定决心要将他们拽入死者的世界一般。

sentences.sContent: The blade and chalice guarding o'er her gates.
sentences.sContent_eng: The blade and chalice guarding o'er her gates.
sentences.sCn: 剑刃和圣餐杯守护在她的门外。

remMethod.val: 拉丁语为calix， 英语中也有calix， 和chalice同词根同词义

trans.tranOther: a gold or silver decorated cup used, for example, to hold wine in Christian religious services
